      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>

          <identifier>
            <catalog>lre</catalog>

          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Coupling reaction between phenyldiazonium chloride and phenol</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Koppelung Reaktion zwischen phenyldiazonium 
Chlorverbindung und Phenol</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Réaction de couplage entre le chlorure de 
phenyldiazonium et le phénol</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Reação do acoplamento entre o cloreto do 
phenyldiazonium e o phenol</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Reazione dell'accoppiamento fra il cloruro di 
phenyldiazonium ed il fenolo</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αντίδραση συζεύξεων μεταξύ του χλωριδίου 
phenyldiazonium και της φαινόλης</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Reacción del acoplador entre el cloruro del 
phenyldiazonium y el fenol</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows the equation for the formation of the dye 4-hydroxyphenylazobenzene by adding phenyldiazonium chloride to an alkaline solution of phenol. The phenyldiazonium ion behaves as an electrophile, and attacks the arene molecule of phenol. Electrophilic substitution takes place, producing the azo dye in a reaction known as coupling reaction.</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">4-hydroxyphenylazobenzene</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">alkaline solution</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">arene</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">azo dye</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">coupling reaction</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">electrophile</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">electrophilic substitution</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">ion</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">molecule</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">phenol</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">phenyldiazonium chloride</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">reaction equation</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung zeigt die Gleichung für die 
Anordnung der Färbung 4-hydroxyphenylazobenzene, indem sie 
phenyldiazonium Chlorverbindung einer alkalischen Lösung des Phenols 
hinzufügt. Das phenyldiazonium Ion benimmt sich als 
electrophile und nimmt das Arenmolekül des Phenols in Angriff. 
Elektrophiler Ersatz findet statt und produziert die azo 
Färbung in einer Reaktion, die als Koppelung Reaktion bekannt ist.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Cette illustration montre l'équation pour la 
formation du colorant 4-hydroxyphenylazobenzene en ajoutant le 
chlorure de phenyldiazonium à une solution alkaline du phénol. 
L'ion de phenyldiazonium se comporte en tant qu'electrophile, et
attaque la molécule d'arène du phénol. La substitution 
électrophile a lieu, produisant le colorant azoïque dans une 
réaction connue sous le nom de réaction de couplage.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra a equação para a 
formação da tintura 4-hydroxyphenylazobenzene adicionando o cloreto 
do phenyldiazonium a uma solução alcalina do phenol. O íon do
phenyldiazonium comporta-se como um electrophile, e ataca-se a 
molécula da arena do phenol. A substituição electrophilic 
ocorre, produzindo a tintura azo em uma reação sabida como a 
reação do acoplamento.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione mostra l'equazione per la 
formazione della tintura 4-hydroxyphenylazobenzene aggiungendo il 
cloruro di phenyldiazonium ad una soluzione alcalina del fenolo. 
Lo ione di phenyldiazonium si comporta come un electrophile ed 
attaca la molecola dell'arene del fenolo. La sostituzione 
elettrofila avviene, producendo la tintura azo in una reazione 
conosciuta come reazione dell'accoppiamento.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση εμφανίζει την εξίσωση για το 
σχηματισμό της χρωστικής ουσίας 4 -4-χυδροξυπχενυλαζοψενζενε με την
προσθήκη του χλωριδίου phenyldiazonium σε μια αλκαλική λύση της
φαινόλης. Το ιόν phenyldiazonium συμπεριφέρεται ως 
electrophile, και επιτίθεται στο arene μόριο της φαινόλης. 
Η ηλεκτρονιόφιλη αντικατάσταση πραγματοποιείται, παράγοντας 
την αζωτούχα χρωστική ουσία σε μια αντίδραση γνωστή ως αντίδραση
συζεύξεων.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra la ecuación para la 
formación del tinte 4-hydroxyphenylazobenzene agregando el cloruro 
del phenyldiazonium a una solución alcalina del fenol. El ion 
del phenyldiazonium se comporta como electrophile, y ataca la 
molécula del arene del fenol. La substitución electrophilic 
ocurre, produciendo el tinte azo en una reacción conocida como 
reacción del acoplador.</string>
          </description>
